intro: Ficus lacunata, commonly known as the weeping fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often shaped like a shield. The plant has a distinctive appearance with long, drooping branches that give it a weeping appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible figs, though the fruit is rarely seen in cultivation. Ficus lacunata is often grown as a houseplant due to its adaptability and ability to thrive in indoor environments.
